benchmark_details.name: BENCHMARKPROFILING
benchmark_details.overview: BENCHMARKPROFILING is a diagnostic framework designed to systematically profile benchmark performance into ten cognitively grounded abilities, quantifying their contributions to a model's success on evaluation benchmarks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a transparent method for diagnosing benchmark capabilities and aligning model evaluations with human-aligned competencies.

data.source: Synthetic datasets for ten operationalized abilities created through targeted prompts and validation by domain experts.
data.annotation: Guided by few-shot examples and validated through expert assessments.

methodology.calculation: AIS is calculated as the normalized performance drop relative to the baseline improvement over chance, highlighting the dependence of benchmarks on specific abilities.
methodology.interpretation: An AIS value near 1 indicates strong dependence on the ability, while values near 0 suggest little reliance.
methodology.validation: Validated through expert evaluations and performance assessments across models.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: All diagnostic items are synthetically generated and contain no personal or identifying details.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: MIT License for research and non-commercial use.
